docs.title: 🖥️ EryzOS - A Minimalist Unix-Like Operating System
🌟 What is EryzOS?
docs.text: EryzOS is a lightweight, Unix-like operating system built from scratch in C and Assembly, designed to explore low-level systems programming, kernel development, and OS internals. This project serves as my learning journey into OS development 🚀.

docs.title: 🔧 Features
docs.text:
• 🖥 Custom kernel with system call handling
  • 📂 Minimalist virtual file system (VFS)
  • 📝 Basic shell for executing user commands
  • 🔄 Round-robin process scheduling
  • 🧠 Paging-based virtual memory management
  • 🌐 Experimental TCP/IP networking stack (WIP)

docs.title: 🛠️ Build & Run
docs.text:
You can run EryzOS using QEMU: 

git clone https://github.com/GabriellaGloria/EryzOS.git
cd EryzOS
make qemu

docs.title: 🖥 Running on Real Hardware
docs.text:
You can flash EryzOS onto a USB and boot it on a real machine (experimental).

  1. Build the OS image 
    make iso
  2. Write to a USB drive (Replace /dev/sdX with your USB device) 
    sudo dd if=eryzos.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M status=progress && sync
  3. Reboot and select USB boot in your BIOS/UEFI settings.

docs.title: 📖 Motivation
docs.text: Hey, I’m Gabriella Gloria, an NUS Computer Science student 🎓, interested in OS dev, systems programming, and cybersecurity. EryzOS is my playground to explore memory management, process scheduling, and low-level hardware interactions.

docs.title: 💻 Contribute
docs.text: This is a personal learning project, but feel free to open issues, suggest improvements, or just chat about OS dev! 😊
